snippet: Lost amid the election-year wrangling over the embassy attack in Benghazi, Libya, is a complex back story involving regional resentment against American private security contractors.
abstract: Election-year wrangling over embassy attacks in Benghazi, Libya, belies a complex back story of regional resentment against American private security contractors and mounting frustration among diplomats who are asked to adhere to ever-tighter security protections; State Department has been forced to rely on its own resource-poor security arm even as it extends its mission to more dangerous areas abroad.
lead_paragraph: Lost amid the election-year wrangling over the embassy attack in Benghazi, Libya, is a complex back story involving regional resentment against American private security contractors.

headline.seo: Private Security Hovers as Issue After Embassy Attack in Benghazi, Libya
headline.main: After Benghazi Attack, Private Security Hovers as an Issue
headline.print_headline: Private Security Hovers as Issue After Benghazi
